metadata.title: CVE-2020-16015 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient data validation in WASM in Google Chrome prior to 87.0.4280.66allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16015` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
